title: School slammed for asking pupils to take oath
text:
A Chinese primary school in Selangor was slammed for asking its Year Six pupils to swear that they would study hard to score 8As in the UPSR examination this year.    
The video of the "oath ceremony", which was held at a school hall, was being circulated on social media recently. 
It was reported that the pupils signed on a paper after taking the oath. 
When contacted, Selangor Headmasters Union chairman He Run Xing said the state Education Department had introduced “Champion” project to encourage schools to improve their UPSR results.    
He said not all Chinese schools requested its pupils to take the oath as different schools used different methods to encourage their pupils to study hard. 
“Besides that, not all the pupils in the school are asked to take the oath to score 8As, only selected pupils participated in it,” he said.  
He added that the pupils would not be punished if they did not score straight A’s in the exam.   



> Faye Wong, Nicholas Tse buy luxury condo   
Hong Kong pop queen Faye Wong and her boyfriend Nicholas Tse are said have bought a luxury condominium in Tsuen Wan, Hong Kong.
Wong’s best friend Chinese actor Vicki Zhao Wei also stayed at the same block with the couple.  
There is speculation that the couple plan to get married.    

Recently, a photo of the 47-year-old Wong kissing Tse at the Hong Kong airport had gone viral on Chinese microblog Weibo.
